contentrichtext.text: {{About|the 1954 American comedy|the 1981 French comedy|La Chèvre}} {{Original research|article|date=October 2009}} {{Infobox film | name = Knock on Wood | image = Knock.jpg | caption = Promotional poster for the film | director = [[Melvin Frank]]<br>[[Norman Panama]] | producer = Melvin Frank<br>Norman Panama | writer = Melvin Frank<br>Norman Panama | starring = [[Danny Kaye]]<br>[[Mai Zetterling]]<br>[[Torin Thatcher]]<br>[[David Burns (actor)|David Burns]]<br>[[Leon Askin]] | music = [[Sylvia Fine]] | cinematography = [[Daniel L. Fapp]] | editing = Alma Macrorie | distributor = [[Paramount Pictures]] | released = {{start date|1954|4|14}} | runtime = 103 minutes | country = United States | language = English | gross = $3.5 million (US)<ref>'The Top Box-Office Hits of 1954', ''Variety Weekly'', January 5, 1955</ref> }} '''''Knock on Wood''''' is a 1954 comedy starring [[Danny Kaye]] and [[Mai Zetterling]]. Other actors in the film include [[Torin Thatcher]], [[David Burns (actor)|David Burns]], and [[Leon Askin]]. The film was written and directed by [[Melvin Frank]] and [[Norman Panama]], with songs by Kaye's wife, [[Sylvia Fine]]. ==Plot== Jerry Morgan (Kaye) is a [[Ventriloquism|ventriloquist]] who is having trouble with love: just when his relationship with a woman gets around to marriage, his dummy turns jealous and spoils everything. Jerry's manager Marty threatens to quit unless Jerry sees a psychiatrist, Ilse Nordstrom (Zetterling), who tries to discover the source of his problem. The two of them eventually fall in love. At the same time, Jerry becomes unwittingly intertwined with spies and has to run from the police. In his escape, he finds himself impersonating a British car salesman, trying to demonstrate a new convertible with loads of bells and whistles. Later on, he finds himself on stage in the middle of the performance of an exotic ballet. ==Production notes== The film features dialogue with linguistic play (particularly the names of the dummies "Clarence" and "Terrence" and the [[Slavic languages|Slavic]] names of the spies) which would also be a feature of Kaye's later film ''[[The Court Jester]]'' (likewise written and directed by Frank and Panama). The title song "Knock on Wood" should not be confused with "Everybody Thinks I'm Crazy" from the 1941 cartoon entitled ''Woody Woodpecker'', starring [[Woody Woodpecker|the character of the same name]]; or the song "Knock on Wood" from the 1942 film, ''[[Casablanca (film)|Casablanca]]'' (with music by M.K. Jerome and lyrics by Jack Scholl). Kaye performed renditions of both the title song from ''Knock on Wood'' and "The Woody Woodpecker Song," which are found on the album ''The Best of Danny Kaye'' [Spectrum, 2000]. ==Cast== * [[Danny Kaye]] as Jerry Morgan and his father * [[Mai Zetterling]] as Doctor Ilse Nordstrom * [[Torin Thatcher]] as Godfrey Langston, the film evil * [[David Burns (actor)|David Burns]] as Marty Brown, Jerrys Manager * [[Leon Askin]] as Lazlo Gromek, a spion * [[Abner Biberman]] as Maurice Papinek, a spion * [[Otto Waldis]] as Brodnik, a spion * [[Gavin Gordon (actor)|Gavin Gordon]] as a Car Salesman * [[Steven Geray]] as Doctor Krüger * [[Diana Adams]] as Princess Maya * [[Patricia Denise]] as Jerrys Mother * [[Virginia Houston]] as Audrey Greene * [[Paul England (Actor)|Paul England]] as the Chief Inspector Wilton * [[Johnstone White]] as Langstons Secretary * [[Henry Brandon (actor)|Henry Brandon]] as the Man with a Trenchcoat * [[Lewis Martin (Actor)|Lewis Martin]] as Inspector Crawford ==DVD release== ''Knock on Wood'' was issued as a region 2 DVD in March 2009, and is on sale through Amazon UK. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{imdb title|0047152|Knock on Wood}} * {{Amg movie|97932|Knock on Wood}} {{Melvin Frank}} {{Norman Panama}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Knock On Wood}} [[Category:American films]] [[Category:1954 films]] [[Category:Films about psychiatry]] [[Category:1950s comedy films]] [[Category:Films directed by Norman Panama]] [[Category:Films directed by Melvin Frank]]
